revised_title: The Influence of Quantity of Matter on Chemical Affinity in Double Chlorides and Oxalates Formation
tldr: The author investigates the influence of quantity of matter on chemical affinity in the formation of double chlorides and oxalates. They demonstrate this through experiments involving the combination of various salts and the observation of crystal formation under a microscope. The results show that the quantity of matter affects the rate of disintegration and the formation of new crystals, providing insights into the processes of chemical reactions and crystal growth.
scientific_discipline: Chemistry > Chemical Bonding and Reaction Mechanisms
